repeat.name: Jimmy
options: I'm very disappointed in you, Barry.
How could you do this, Barry?
Barry, you need to fix this.

1_a.text: I don't know how this could have happened, Sir.
options: That's a bit difficult to believe, Barry.
Well, we need to find a way to fix it now.
I imagine it had something to do with you fiddling with computer settings you had no business interfering with.

1_a_2.content: Yes sir. I'm working on it right now, Sir.

2_a.text: I didn't mean to do it, Sir.
options: You didn't mean to make the computer virtually impossible to use, thus jeopardising the crew, the ship and the mission?
Well, that's great. As long as you're sorry.
I'm pleased to hear it. I was about to put you on report, but since you seem so sincerely sorry, I'll let you off.

2_a_1_a_1.text: . . . I'll still need to fix this though, won't I?
options: Yes, Barry. You need to fix the computer so we don't all die from your idiocy. That would be very good of you.
No, Barry, you colossal moron.

3_a.text: I know Sir, I'm working on it.
options: Let me know how you get on.
What are you doing to fix it?
Do you know what's going to happen if you don't sort this out?
What's that?
Wait, I have an idea.
Whatever it is Barry, you had better have a good plan.

3_a_2_a.content:
I'm going to try pressing a button.||

Nope, nothing.

options: What kind of training did you get when you were qualifying to be a Pilot?
Try pushing random buttons.
I think you should not touch anything and let me and John try to fix this.

3_a_2_b_1.text: Aerodynamics, calculus, spatial geometry, mechanical engineering, first aid, how to drink 7 shots of rum and vomit out your nose, navigation...
options: Navigation! Wait, seven shots and what? No, nevermind actually.
You must have learned about observing your surroundings, noticing minor details and changes of scenery?

3_a_2_b_1_a_1.text: Uh, yes Sir I suppose so.
options: If you replay the scene in your head, can you visualise the console again? All the keys and screens you saw to change the language the first time?

3_a_2_b_1_a_1_a.content:
. . .|

Actually Sir, I think I just about can.

3_a_2_b_1_a_1_a_1.text: Yes... yes..... yes! YES! I've got it!
options: You've fixed it?

3_a_2_b_1_a_1_a_1_a.content:
Uh, not completely Sir. But it looks like it's a little bit better. I'll keep trying.

[Barry has fixed the computer interface by 10%]

options: Yes.
No.

3_a_2_b_2_a.content:
Okay, Sir. Here goes. . .||

Well, so much for that.

3_a_2_b_2_b.content: Okay, let me know when you want me to do something Sir.

options: Barry?
You were going to start pushing random buttons, weren't you Barry?

3_a_2_c_a_1.content: Kind of yes, Sir. Sorry Sir.

options: Can you imagine not being able to order those spicy kebabs from the food dispenser?
Can you imagine not being able to activate the turbolift to get back to your quarters?
Can you imagine the crew collectively stuffing you into the airlock?
Can you imagine what the rest of the crew is going to do to us if they find out?
Get to work, Barry.
And getting angrier by the minute.

3_a_3_c.text: But they won't be able to open the outer doors without a voice confirmation.
options: I'm sure they'd figure something out.

3_a_3_d.text: I don't want to think about it.
options: Soon you won't have a choice.
How could you change the language settings like that? Doesn't it need an admin password?
Why did you think you could learn a new language so quickly?
Why didn't you tell us as soon as it happened?
Do you have some higher authorisation that I don't know about?
How did you know what the captain's password was?

4_a_1_a.text: No Sir, it was just luck.
options: "password"?
"qwerty"?
"ford"?

4_a_1_b.text: Someone left a sticky note with the password on my console from the last shift.
options: I guess that means another Watch is first up for cleaning the heads next Saturday, at least.

4_a_2.text: I heard that when you go to a new country you learn the language really quickly.
options: How quickly?
Changing the computer interface isn't like going to a new country. It's like you picking up a foreign book and trying to read it immediately.

4_a_2_a.text: Uh, I don't know. I guess . . . |a few months, instead of a few years?
options: Barry, stop talking.

4_a_2_b.text: Yes, Sir. I realised that after about three seconds.
options: Barry, stop talking.

4_a_3.text: I was a bit embarrassed and hoped maybe it wouldn't be that noticeable.
options: You thought that we wouldn't notice that the computer was IN ANOTHER LANGUAGE?

4_a_3_a.text: It kind of looks a bit like English. . .
options: Barry.
Barry.

4_a_3_a_1_a.text: A couple of the letters look the same. . .
options: Barry, stop talking.
